Hager.jpg |jr/sr = United States Senator |state = [[California]] |term_start = December 23, 1873 |term_end = March 4, 1875 |predecessor = [[Eugene Casserly]] |successor = [[Newton Booth]] |birth_date = {{birth date|1818|3|12}} |birth_place = [[Morristown, New Jersey|Morristown]], [[New Jersey]] |death_date = {{death date and age|1890|3|19|1818|3|12}} |death_place = [[San Francisco]], [[California]] |party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] }} '''John Sharpenstein Hager''' (March 12, 1818{{spaced ndash}}March 19, 1890) was an [[Politics of the United States|American politician]] from the [[U.S. state]] of [[California]]. He served in the [[United States Senate|U.S. Senate]] from 1873 to 1875. ==Life== Hager was born near [[Morristown, New Jersey]], on March 12, 1818. He completed preparatory studies and graduated from the [[Princeton University|College of New Jersey]] (later named Princeton University) in 1836. Hager studied law and was [[Admission to the bar|admitted to the bar]] in 1840, practicing in Morristown. In 1849, Hager moved to California and engaged in mining during the [[California Gold Rush]]. He practiced law in [[San Francisco, California|San Francisco]] and was a member of the [[1849 California Constitutional Convention]]. Hager served in the [[California Senate]] from 1852 to 1854, before being elected as a state district judge for the district of San Francisco in 1855. Hagar remained a district judge until 1861. In 1865, Hager returned to the state senate, serving until 1871, when he was elected a [[regent]] of the [[University of California]] Hager was elected as an anti-[[monopoly]] [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] to the U.S. Senate to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of [[Eugene Casserly]] and served from December 23, 1873, to March 4, 1875. He was not a candidate for renomination in 1874. In 1879, Hager was a member of the state constitutional convention. He was collector of customs of the [[port of San Francisco]] from 1885 to 1889. Hager died in San Francisco on March 19, 1890 and was interred at [[Bellefontaine Cemetery]] in [[St. Louis, Missouri]]. ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=April 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== {{CongBio|H000016}} *{{Cite Appletons'|wstitle=Hager, John Sharpenstien|year=1892}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|us-sen}} {{U.S. Senator box |state=California |class=1 |before=[[Eugene Casserly]] |after=[[Newton Booth]] |alongside=[[Aaron Augustus Sargent|Aaron A.
